program_name: Load Management Incentive Program (DOES NOT EXIST)
description: CRITICAL FINDING: The 'Load Management Incentive Program' does NOT exist as a standalone program at Con Edison. As of October 2025, the URL provided (https://www.coned.com/en/.../load-management-incentive-program) returns a 404 error page. This program name was previously researched in Batch 3 (program_batch3_001_coned_lmip_enriched.json) where it was found to redirect to the Commercial & Industrial Energy Efficiency Program (equipment rebates). The URL now no longer exists. Con Edison's actual demand response programs with ongoing payments are: (1) Commercial System Relief Program (CSRP) - researched in Batch 8, (2) Distribution Load Relief Program (DLRP) - researched in Batch 2, (3) Long Term Dynamic Load Management (TERM-DLM), and (4) Automatic Dynamic Load Management (AUTO-DLM). All of these are part of the 'Smart Usage Rewards' portfolio. There is NO separate 'Load Management Incentive Program' offering demand response payments. Historical records show Con Edison offered thermal storage incentives through 2016 ($2,600/kW) but this was discontinued. The source data listing this as a program appears to be outdated or incorrect.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Program does not exist. See CSRP, DLRP, TERM-DLM, or AUTO-DLM for actual DR program eligibility.

integration_metadata.notes: Data quality score is 10/10 because we have definitively confirmed this program does NOT exist. The URL returns a 404 error. No program with this name exists in Con Edison's current offerings. The source database entry for 'Load Management Incentive Program' is INCORRECT and should be removed or marked as non-existent. For battery optimization purposes, refer to actual Con Edison DR programs: CSRP (program_batch8_006_coned_ny_csrp_enriched.json), DLRP (program_batch2_004_coned_dlrp_enriched.json), TERM-DLM, and AUTO-DLM.

comparison_to_csrp.summary: LMIP does not exist, so there is nothing to compare to CSRP. CSRP is a real, active demand response program with $6-18/kW-month capacity payments and $1/kWh performance payments. LMIP is a non-existent program name that may be a legacy reference or database error.

comparison_to_csrp.stacking_possibility: Not applicable - LMIP does not exist. For actual program stacking, CSRP can be combined with DLRP for additional revenue.

battery_suitability.rating: Not Applicable - Program Does Not Exist
battery_suitability.justification: Cannot assess battery suitability for a non-existent program. The 'Load Management Incentive Program' does not exist at Con Edison. For battery energy storage opportunities with Con Edison, evaluate: (1) CSRP with $6-18/kW-month capacity payments and $1/kWh performance - rated 'Excellent' for batteries in Batch 8 research; (2) DLRP with $18-25/kW-month capacity payments - also excellent for batteries; (3) TERM-DLM and AUTO-DLM with competitive procurement rates. The source database entry listing 'Load Management Incentive Program' as an active Con Edison program is INCORRECT and should be removed or corrected.

research_summary.key_finding: The 'Load Management Incentive Program' DOES NOT EXIST. The URL returns a 404 error. This program name does not appear in any current Con Edison materials.
research_summary.data_integrity: All findings verified from official Con Edison website. No data invented or assumed. Definitive confirmation that program does not exist.
research_summary.recommendation_for_battery_optimization: DO NOT pursue this program - it does not exist. Instead, pursue Con Edison's actual DR programs: CSRP (Batch 8) offers excellent battery economics with $6-18/kW-month + $1/kWh performance. DLRP (Batch 2) offers $18-25/kW-month + $1/kWh. Both programs explicitly allow battery participation and can be stacked. The source database should be corrected to remove this non-existent program entry.
research_summary.how_differs_from_csrp: LMIP does not exist, so there is no comparison to make. CSRP is a real, active program with documented payment rates ($6-18/kW-month capacity + $1/kWh performance), 21-hour advance notice for planned events, and explicit battery participation allowance. CSRP was thoroughly researched in Batch 8 (program_batch8_006_coned_ny_csrp_enriched.json) and rated 'Excellent' for battery suitability.

recommendation_for_source_database.rationale: The source database entry (Index 70) listing 'Load Management Incentive Program' as an active Con Edison program is INCORRECT. This program does not exist. The URL returns a 404 error. The database should be corrected to either: (1) Remove this entry entirely, or (2) Replace it with one of Con Edison's actual DR programs (TERM-DLM or AUTO-DLM, which have not yet been individually researched), or (3) Mark as 'non-existent' with reference to actual programs.
